panel.covid19.qr_code.title: COVID-19 QR Code
panel.covid19.qr_code.description.headin: If you use more than one device with the Safer Illinois app, use this QR code to transfer the necessary secret to decode your COVID-19 health information.
Save this QR code so that If you lose or replace your phone, you can retrieve your COVID-19 health information on your new phone.

panel.covid19.qr_code.description.on_boa: Save this QR code so that If you lose or replace your phone, you can retrieve your COVID-19 health information on your new phone.
You can always skip this step for now and do it later in Settings
panel.covid19.transfer.title: Transfer Encryption Key
panel.covid19.transfer.label.save_error: Unable to save the QR code.
panel.covid19.transfer.secondary.heading: Missing COVID-19 Encryption Key
If you are adding a second device:
If you still have access to your primary device, you can directly scan the COVID-19 Encryption Key QR code from that device.
If you are using a replacement device:
If you no longer have access to your primary device, but saved your QR code to a cloud photo service, you can transfer your COVID-19 Encryption Key by retrieving it from your photos.

panel.health.onboarding.covid19.intro.la: Manage your health to help keep our Illinois community safe
panel.health.onboarding.covid19.how_it_w: Testing and limiting exposure are key to slowing the spread of COVID-19.
You can use this app to:
Self-report your COVID-19 symptoms and in doing so update your status.
Automatically receive test results from your healthcare provider.
Allow your phone to send exposure notifications when you’ve been in proximity to people who test positive.
If you consent to exposure notifications, you allow your phone to send an anonymous Bluetooth signal to nearby Safer Illinois app users who are also using this feature. Your phone will receive and record a signal from their phones as well. If one of those users tests positive for COVID-19 in the next 14 days, the app will alert you to your potential exposure and advise you on next steps. Your identity and health status will remain anonymous, as will the identity and health status of all other users.
I consent to participate in the Exposure Notification System (requires Bluetooth to be ON).
I consent to allow my healthcare provider to provide my test results.
I consent to connect test results from my healthcare provider with the Safer Illinois app.
Your participation in these COVID-19 features is voluntary, and you can stop at any time
panel.health.onboarding.covid19.resident: Verify your identity with a government-issued ID
After verifying you will receive a color-coded health status based on your county guidelines, symptoms, and any COVID-19 related tests.
panel.health.onboarding.covid19.county.l: What counties do you live and work in?
panel.health.onboarding.covid19.county.a: Please, select different county in each field!
panel.health.onboarding.covid19.provider: Who are your current healthcare providers?
panel.health.onboarding.covid19.final.la: You've been verified, and a status card has been added to your profile.
You can now use this app as your companion in the fight against COVID-19.
You can now use this app as your companion in the fight against COVID-19.
To access your COVID-19 status, you will need to upload a Government ID. You can add this any time in the COVID-19 settings.
panel.health.onboarding.covid19.login.ne: Log in with your NetID to use academic and housing specific features.

panel.health.covid19.about.heading.title: About
panel.health.covid19.add_test.label.info: from your healthcare provider are instantly verified. Any changes to your health status will be reflected instantly.
will be reviewed and verified by a public healthcare provider. Once verified, status changes may occur.
panel.health.covid19.add_test.label.manu: Test results from this health care provider will automatically appear if you have consented to Health Provider Test Results in settings and you are connected with your NetID.
panel.health.covid19.care_team.label.des: Reach out to someone on your COVID-19 care team - we're here to help.
panel.health.covid19.care_team.team.desc: Reach out to someone on the “Dial a Nurse Line” to discuss your symptoms and options for clinical care.

We’ve partnered with OSF OnCall Connect program and the Illinois Department of Healthcare and Family Services to support you getting through COVID-19. Call the Nurse Hotline at 1-833-OSF-KNOW (833-673-5669) to learn more about the program, which includes delivery of a care kit and digital visits to monitor you over a 16-day period.
panel.health.covid19.care_team.label.mor: More about the OSF OnCall Connect program

Members of the OSF OnCall Connect care team are trained OSF HealthCare Mission Partners who connect with you to provide support and work with you and health care providers as you recover from COVID-19, decreasing the risk of further exposure. OSF OnCall Connect team members check on you daily and should your condition worsen, you will be referred to the Acute COVID@Home program where you will receive monitoring equipment that allows us to evaluate your blood pressure, heart rate and pulse ox.
Double tap to show more info

panel.health.covid19.qr_code.label.save_: Unable to save the QR code.
panel.health.covid19.qr_code.primary.des:
For your privacy, your healthcare data used for COVID-19 features is encrypted. The encryption key is stored locally on your phone to keep it secure. 

To use the COVID-19 features on another device, you will need to manually transfer this encryption key using the QR code below.

In the event your current device is lost or damaged, we suggest you save a copy of this QR code to a cloud photo storage service, so that it can be retrieved on your replacement device. 

You can access and save this key on this device at any time by accessing "Transfer Your COVID-19 Encryption Key" from the COVID-19 info center.
panel.health.covid19.qr_code.secondary.h: Looks like you’ve used this feature before on another device
panel.health.covid19.qr_code.secondary.d:
Do you want to transfer your QR encyrption key to this device to retreive your previous health information?

Select which one applies to you below. You can always transfer a QR encryption key to this device at a later time using the “Transfer Your COVID-19 Encyrption Key” in the COVID-19 info center or in your app settings.
panel.health.covid19.qr_code.secondary.b: If you are adding a second device:
If you still have access to your primary device, you can directly scan the COVID-19 Encryption Key QR code from that device.
If you are using a replacement device:
If you no longer have access to your primary device, but saved your QR code to a cloud photo service, you can transfer your COVID-19 Encryption Key by retrieving it from your photos.
panel.health.covid19.qr_code.dialog.refr: Doing this will provide you a new COVID-19 Secret QRcode but your previous COVID-19 event history will be lost, continue?
